title: Question 11 Write a Formula (NEW)
prompt:
At a hardware store, a 20 foot chain is cut n times into equal parts.

Choose the algebraic expression that represents the length in feet of each part and drag it to the box at the right.
feedback:
<math>
 <mtable columnalign='left'>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>When the chain is cut </mtext><mi>N</mi><mtext> times, it is cut into </mtext><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext> parts</mtext><mtext>.</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>(For example, if the chain was cut 3 times, there would</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>3 + 1 = 4 parts)</mtext><mtext>. So, the length of each part would be </mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>the length of the chain, 20 feet, divided by the number </mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>of parts, </mtext><mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1.</mn>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>                          Answer: </mtext><mfrac>
     <mrow>
      <mn>20</mn></mrow>
     <mrow>
      <mi>N</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow>
    </mfrac>
    
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>
